channel.title: Stockwatch - Key Events
channel.description: Real-time corporate announcements, deals, and financial results.

item.title: [DEVYANI] Devyani International Ltd. to Approve Q3 Results and Preference Shares Issuance
item.description:
Devyani International Ltd. has announced a Board of Directors meeting on February 4, 2026, to consider and approve the unaudited financial results for the quarter and nine months ended December 31, 2025, on both standalone and consolidated bases. The company also plans to issue non-convertible preference shares on a private placement basis to discharge the consideration payable for acquiring additional equity stake in its subsidiary, Sky Gate Hospitality Private Limited. This issuance is subject to the approval of equity shareholders at an extraordinary general meeting or through a postal ballot process. The trading window will remain closed till February 6, 2026.

  • Devyani International Ltd. to approve Q3 results for 2025
  • Company to consider issuing non-convertible preference shares for stake acquisition in Sky Gate Hospitality
  • Issuance of preference shares subject to equity shareholder approval
  • Trading window to remain closed till February 6, 2026

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: Devyani International Ltd | Category: Quarterly Result

item.title: [BLUESTARCO] Blue Star Ltd. Discloses Unauthorized Access to Product Installation Data
item.description:
Blue Star Ltd. has informed about an incident where some unauthorized person has accessed their product installation data. The company took immediate action to restrict access and is now working with cyber security experts to assess its potential impact and conduct a thorough root cause analysis. This disclosure is made as a matter of good governance, and the Compliance Officer was made aware of the incident on January 31, 2026, at 10:30 p.m. The information is also available on the company's website.

  • Blue Star Ltd. disclosed unauthorized access to their product installation data
  • Company took immediate action to restrict access
  • Working with cyber security experts to assess potential impact
  • Incident reported to the Compliance Officer on January 31, 2026
  • Information made available on the company's website

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: BLUE STAR LTD. | Category: Legal

item.title: [SHREECEM] Shree Cement Ltd: Vinod Kumar Chaturvedi Ceases to be Chief Human Resources Officer, Manmohan Rathi Takes Over
item.description:
Shree Cement Ltd has announced a change in its senior management. Mr. Vinod Kumar Chaturvedi, the Chief Human Resources Officer, will be assuming a new role in the company and ceased to be a Senior Management Person with effect from 31st January 2026. Mr. Manmohan Rathi, Joint President â€” Power Management, who is already a Senior Management Person, has been assigned the additional responsibility of Chief Human Resources Officer in place of Mr. Chaturvedi.

  • Vinod Kumar Chaturvedi ceases to be Chief Human Resources Officer
  • Manmohan Rathi assumes additional responsibility as Chief Human Resources Officer
  • Change in senior management at Shree Cement Ltd

Company: SHREE CEMENT LTD. | Category: New Launch

item.title: [NSLNISP] Smt. Priyadarshini Gaddam Retires as Director (Personnel) from NMDC Steel Ltd Board
item.description:
NMDC Steel Ltd announced the retirement of Smt. Priyadarshini Gaddam as Director (Personnel) from its Board. The retirement follows the Ministry of Steel, Government of India Order No. 3(3)/2020-BLA dated 28.02.2025 and the earlier Order dated 20.03.2023. Smt. Gaddam reached the age of superannuation on 31.01.2026, resulting in her ceasing to be a Director (Personnel) on the Board of the company on the same date.

  • Smt. Priyadarshini Gaddam retires as Director (Personnel) from NMDC Steel Ltd Board.
  • The retirement follows the Ministry of Steel, Government of India Order No. 3(3)/2020-BLA dated 28.02.2025 and the earlier Order dated 20.03.2023.
  • Smt. Gaddam reached the age of superannuation on 31.01.2026.
  • NMDC Steel Ltd provided an updated list of Directors on the Board.
  • The company is a Government of India Enterprise.

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: NMDC Steel Ltd | Category: Board Meeting

item.title: [MOIL] Moil Ltd Increases Manganese Ore Prices by 5-10% for February 2026
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Moil Ltd, in line with its business practice, has fixed/revised prices of different grades of Manganese Ore and other products, effective from 01.02.2026. The prices of all Ferro grades of manganese ore with Manganese content of Mn- 44% and above have been increased by 5%. The prices of all other Ferro grades of manganese ore with Manganese content below Mn-44% have also been increased by 5%, except BG4584 which continues the January 2026 price for the month of February 2026. The prices of SMGR (Mn-30%), Fines grades, and Chemical grades have been increased by 5%. The prices of SMGR (Mn 25%) and SMGR (Mn 20%) grades have been continued for the month of February 2026. The prices of Metal Mandi Fines have been continued, except for UKF532 which has seen a 10% increase. The basic price of EMD has been continued for the month of February 2026.

  • Moil Ltd increases Manganese Ore prices by 5-10% for February 2026
  • Prices of Ferro grades of manganese ore with Mn- 44% and above increased by 5%
  • Prices of other Ferro grades of manganese ore, SMGR, Fines, and Chemical grades increased by 5%
  • Prices of SMGR (Mn 25%) and SMGR (Mn 20%) grades continued for February 2026
  • Price of UKF532 Metal Mandi Fines increased by 10% for February 2026

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: MOIL LTD. | Category: Monthly Update

item.title: [GUJINV] Gujarat Investa Ltd to Approve Q3 Financial Results and Contemplate Fund Raising in Upcoming Board Meeting
item.description:
Gujarat Investa Ltd, formerly known as Ashtasiddhi Industries Limited, has announced a Board meeting scheduled for 7th February, 2026. The meeting aims to approve the unaudited financial results for the third quarter and nine months ended on 31st December, 2025. The company also plans to consider and evaluate a proposal to raise funds through the issuance of Equity Shares/warrants by way of Preferential Allotment or any other method as may be decided by the Board. The meeting will also fix the day, date, time, and venue of the meeting and approve the draft notice for raising funds. The trading window for the shares of the company, which was closed with effect from 1st January, 2026, will remain closed till 48 hours after the announcement of the unaudited financial results.

  • Gujarat Investa Ltd to approve Q3 financial results for the period ended on 31st December, 2025
  • Company to consider and evaluate a proposal to raise funds through Equity Shares/warrants by way of Preferential Allotment
  • The meeting will fix the day, date, time, and venue of the meeting and approve the draft notice for raising funds
  • Trading window for the shares of the company to remain closed till 48 hours after the announcement of the financial results

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: GUJARAT INVESTA LTD. | Category: Quarterly Result

item.title: [TFCILTD] Tourism Finance Corporation of India to Invest up to 5% in Oxyzo Credit Fund I
item.description:
Tourism Finance Corporation of India Ltd (TFCI) has announced its decision to invest up to 5% of its corpus fund in Oxyzo Credit Fund I. This debt-focused Alternative Investment Fund is registered with the Securities and Exchange Board of India and targets diversified sectors. This information was disclosed in continuation to a previous letter dated January 30, 2026.

  • TFCI to invest up to 5% in Oxyzo Credit Fund I
  • Oxyzo Credit Fund I is a debt-focused Alternative Investment Fund
  • Registered with the Securities and Exchange Board of India
  • Targets diversified sectors
  • Disclosed in continuation to a previous letter dated January 30, 2026

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: TOURISM FINANCE CORPORATION OF INDIA LTD. | Category: Investment

item.title: [HEROMOTOCO] Hero MotoCorp Marks 25 Consecutive Years of Market Leadership, Records 26% Dispatch Growth
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Hero MotoCorp, the world's largest two-wheeler manufacturer, has maintained its market leadership for 25 consecutive years. The company recorded dispatches of 557,871 units in January 2026, a robust 26% growth compared to 442,873 units in January 2025. The strong growth was driven by the scooter segment and the motorcycle portfolio, led by Xoom, Destini, Xtreme, and Glamour X. VIDA, Hero MotoCorpâ€™s Emerging Mobility business, continued its market share performance with 13,000 VAHAN registrations in January 2026. The companyâ€™s Global Business maintained strong momentum with a 24% dispatch growth. Hero MotoCorp was recognized as an ESG Leader among automotive companies and VIDAâ€™s DIRT.E K3 was recognized as a CES 2026 Innovation Award Honoree.

  • Hero MotoCorp maintained its position as the world's largest two-wheeler manufacturer for 25 consecutive years
  • The company recorded dispatches of 557,871 units in January 2026, a 26% growth compared to January 2025
  • Strong growth in the scooter segment and motorcycle portfolio, led by Xoom, Destini, Xtreme, and Glamour X
  • VIDA continued its market share performance with 13,000 VAHAN registrations in January 2026
  • Hero MotoCorp's Global Business maintained strong momentum with a 24% dispatch growth

Company: HERO MOTOCORP LTD. | Category: Quarterly Updates

item.title: [NMDC] NMDC Ltd Announces Change in Board of Directors: Smt. Priyadarshini Gaddam Retires
item.description:
NMDC Ltd, a prominent name in the steel industry, has announced a change in its Board of Directors. Smt. Priyadarshini Gaddam, Director (Personnel), has ceased to be a member of the Board as she has reached the age of superannuation on 31.01.2026. The Ministry of Steel, Government of India, had appointed her as Director (Personnel) on the Board of NMDC Limited. The updated list of Directors on the Board of NMDC Limited is now available.

  • Smt. Priyadarshini Gaddam has retired as Director (Personnel) from the Board of NMDC Ltd.
  • She reached the age of superannuation on 31.01.2026 and has been relieved from the services of the company.
  • The Ministry of Steel, Government of India, had appointed her as Director (Personnel) on the Board of NMDC Limited.
  • The list of Directors on the Board of NMDC Limited has been updated.
  • The change in the Board of Directors is in compliance with Regulation 30 of the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015.

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: NMDC LTD. | Category: Board Meeting

item.title: [RECLTD] REC Ltd: Shri Harsh Baweja Retires as Director (Finance); Shri Jitendra Srivastava Takes Additional Charge
item.description:
REC Ltd has announced a change in its Board of Directors. Shri Harsh Baweja, Director (Finance), has superannuated from the services of the company on January 31, 2026, and has ceased to be the Director (Finance) and Chief Financial Officer of REC with effect from February 1, 2026. The Ministry of Power, Government of India, has entrusted the additional charge of the post of Director (Finance) to Shri Jitendra Srivastava (IAS), Chairman & Managing Director of REC, for a period of 3 months or until the appointment of a regular incumbent to the post or until further order, whichever is earlier.

  • Shri Harsh Baweja has retired as Director (Finance) of REC Ltd.
  • Shri Jitendra Srivastava has been given additional charge as Director (Finance) of REC Ltd.

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: REC Ltd | Category: Board Meeting
